description: Power dynamics and relationship tensions in Turning Torso Protocol

Erik_Månsson.power_dynamic: Erik has institutional power; Saga has moral clarity
Erik_Månsson.tension: He dismisses her complaints as paranoia; she sees him as willfully blind
Erik_Månsson.evolution: Moves from professional frustration to direct confrontation to mutual understanding (possibly)

Aisha_Osman.power_dynamic: Peer relationship but Aisha has social proof on her side
Aisha_Osman.tension: Aisha's comfort reveals Saga's discomfort as choice; ideological divide masked as friendship
Aisha_Osman.evolution: Friendly concern → awkward distance → potential awakening or permanent rift

Viktor_Bergman.power_dynamic: Equal as fellow resisters; Viktor has experience, Saga has energy
Viktor_Bergman.tension: Both fear being dismissed as paranoid; validation vs. wanting to be wrong
Viktor_Bergman.evolution: Cautious recognition → tentative alliance → deep solidarity

Lena_Holmqvist.power_dynamic: Lena has expertise; Saga has ground-truth data
Lena_Holmqvist.tension: Lena knows the theory but needs proof; Saga has proof but needs framework
Lena_Holmqvist.evolution: Skeptical contact → mutual validation → collaborative resistance

Aisha_Osman.power_dynamic: Erik serves her, but she validates his system
Aisha_Osman.tension: None - she's his proof that 'the system works'
Aisha_Osman.evolution: Remains positive; she's his defense against criticism

Viktor_Bergman.power_dynamic: Erik has authority; Viktor has stubbornness
Viktor_Bergman.tension: Viktor's non-compliance hurts Erik's metrics but can't be forced
Viktor_Bergman.evolution: Professional courtesy → barely masked frustration → potential guilt

Lena_Holmqvist.power_dynamic: Ideological opponents; Lena has moral authority, Erik has institutional backing
Lena_Holmqvist.tension: Represents everything she warns about; he sees her as impractical idealist
Lena_Holmqvist.evolution: Mutual dismissal → direct conflict if they meet

Viktor_Bergman.tension: She thinks he's being difficult; he thinks she's naive
Viktor_Bergman.evolution: Polite distance → possible awakening or deepening divide

Lena_Holmqvist.power_dynamic: Lena has academic authority; Aisha has lived confidence
Lena_Holmqvist.tension: Aisha's lifestyle is what Lena warns against
Lena_Holmqvist.evolution: Not met → potential clash of worldviews or conversion moment

Lena_Holmqvist.power_dynamic: Mutual respect - different types of expertise
Lena_Holmqvist.tension: Viktor has empirical observations; Lena has theoretical framework

central_conflicts: Compliance (Aisha) vs. Resistance (Saga, Viktor) - the biometric divide
Institutional authority (Erik) vs. Individual observation (Saga, Viktor)
Convenience vs. Privacy - the core thematic tension embodied in relationships
Expertise (Lena) vs. Dismissal (Erik) - who gets to define problems
